pullRequest.body:
Synchronise the early steps with the main build workflow: the differences were minor and not essential, but there is little point in being different. Best reviewed by `diff`ing against `build.yml`.

It would be nice to avoid the copy-pasting of e.g. the build mathlib jobs: that pre-existing issue is left for future PRs.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9332275559/job/25687927004)

Yep, I agree with all of this.

maintainer merge

Something which is not really clear from the description is what happens if a PR already exists. Reading `./scripts/update_nolints_CI.sh`, it seems that simply nothing happens, but personally I would have expected the PR to be updated.

Sure, let's make the wording more precise. :-) I'd rather ensure these PRs get merged quickly than spend time on improving the workflow for a scenario that hopefully never happens.
```suggestion
      - name: file a new PR to update nolints.json and style-exceptions.txt

```suggestion
      - name: annotate the PR, update nolints.json and style-exceptions.txt
```

Actually, no, your description is completely wrong: it does not update any file, it only recreates `nolints.json` and `style-exceptions.txt` for the purpose of diffing them with the existing ones.
```suggestion
      - name: lint mathlib, annotate with linting and style errors
```
After #13343, this will be correct: let's just land that PR first.
That PR has landed, so this hunk is now removed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: clean up `nolints.yml` workflow
